title: 115_hr4178
content: The Act is named the "Healthcare Enhancement for Americas Rural Towns Act" or the "HEART Act." It includes reforms and a permanent extension of the Medicare-Dependent Hospital (MDH) Program. The "Healthcare Enhancement for Americas Rural Towns Act" (HEART Act) includes reforms and a permanent extension of the Medicare-Dependent Hospital (MDH) Program, amending the payment methodology under the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2018 and subsequent years. The Secretary will determine an increase factor for medicare-dependent, small rural hospitals for fiscal year 2019 and beyond, to ensure similar reimbursement amounts as if the original clause applied. The aggregate amounts for subsection (d) hospitals that are medicare-dependent, small rural hospitals shall not exceed $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2019 and increase annually based on the market basket percentage increase. The target amount for subsection (d) hospitals is amended to increase annually based on the market basket percentage increase for subsequent fiscal years. Hospitals are permitted to decline reclassification under certain conditions. The target amount for subsection (d) hospitals will increase annually based on the market basket percentage increase for subsequent fiscal years. SEC. 3. TEMPORARY EXTENSION OF THE MEDICARE LOW-VOLUME ADJUSTMENT PROGRAM. Section 1886(d)(12) of the Social Security Act is amended to adjust applicable percentage increases for fiscal years 2011 through 2019. Section 1886(d)(12) of the Social Security Act is amended to adjust applicable percentage increases for fiscal years 2011 through 2019 by removing references to "or the portion of fiscal year" each place it appears. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will adjust payments under section 1886(d) of the Social Security Act to ensure that expenditures for each fiscal year with the amendments made by this Act are equal to expenditures without the amendments.
